intro: Canthium apiculatifolium, commonly known as the pointed-leaf canthium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves that give it its specific epithet. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in tropical botany and ecological adaptation.
